main event: Bright unidentified objects were observed at Thule AFB, Greenland, on December 9, 1953, initially evaluated as a meteorological phenomenon.
interesting points: The meteor was described as a British white, oblong light with no tail or exhaust and a speed estimated at 1,500 mph., Observations included excellent weather conditions with clear visibility of 10 miles., The sighting lasted for approximately 2 to 3 minutes., Multiple reports suggested it appeared to shine light through its body., The report was signed by Captain Harold R. Collier, Chief Intelligence Officer of the USAF.
